frontend

Interface ObjectManager<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EditorPaneManager, HelpPaneManager, SimulationPaneManager, SlogoBaseUIManager, TabbedHTMLDisplayManager, Workspace

    public interface ObjectManager<T>
    ObjectManager is an interface used to describe classes that "manage" an object. The class that implements the ObjectManager interface is responsible for the setup and maintenance of the object that it manages. It can allow other classes to reference the object via the getObject method. Below are a few examples of how one can extend and/or implement this interface in a useful way: A class that is designed to work on the front end of a project may manage a Parent or Scene object. For example, a class may be called PongManager implements ObjectManager. The class may contain many UI elements as well as logical elements that control the UI elements, but other classes only need to know that PongManager creates a Region object that can be put in a Scene and displayed to user to allow the user to play the classic Pong game. The ObjectManager interface could be extended into something like CompositeManager>. This would allow client code to control many objects via the same method calls, thus eliminating the need for client code to loop through all the objects. The class that implements the CompositeManager interface can handle looping through the Collection.
    Author:
    Dylan Peters

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T getObject()
      Returns the object that is managed by the class implementing the ObjectManager interface.

    • Method Detail

      • getObject

        T getObject()
        Returns the object that is managed by the class implementing the ObjectManager interface. The object returned must be of the type specified in the generics in the class declaration. This helps ensure accurate typing.
        Returns:
        the object that is managed by the class implementing the ObjectManager interface.
